name: Kieran Vasquez
text_appearance:
Kieran Vasquez cuts a sharp, battle-hardened figure that reflects both their engineering roots and frontline combat experience. Standing just under average height, they carry themselves with a quiet confidence, wrapped in a weathered, dark pilot’s jumpsuit reinforced with tactical harnesses and tool straps. Their outfit is marked by signs of wear—burnt seams, oil stains, and faded insignias—yet meticulously maintained where it counts, a testament to their engineer’s precision.

A cascade of white hair, accented with a striking teal streak, spills from beneath a pair of worn polarized goggles perched on their brow. The right side of their face bears sleek cybernetic implants, etched along the jaw and temple—interfaces for their nanotech augmentations. Tiny glowing nano-bots often skitter along their suit or skin, an unsettling yet fascinating reminder of the tech symbiosis they command.

Their left arm, entirely cybernetic, is a brutal mix of industrial design and advanced function—crafted not for aesthetics, but for durability and adaptability in both engineering work and combat. In their gloved right hand, they carry a rugged holo-slate, its interface flickering with schematics, code snippets, and targeting overlays.

Kieran’s expression is one of sharp focus—cold, calculating, yet not devoid of empathy. It’s the look of someone who has seen both the workshop and the battlefield, and knows exactly where they stand in either.
notes:
“Everything breaks… it’s how you fix it that counts.”

Kieran Vasquez was never meant to be a soldier.
Born in the Martian orbital colonies, they were the child of generational engineers — workers who built the ships and reactors that powered humanity’s expansion. Gifted with a mind wired for mechanics and microstructures, Kieran rose quickly through the Nanotechnics Division of the Ikaros Research Conglomerate, working on experimental nano-reactive systems designed for industrial self-repair and advanced material integration.

Their career, however, imploded — quite literally — when a classified nanite experiment went rogue, devouring a research station’s core and forcing Kieran into a desperate fight for survival. Stranded for three weeks with failing life support, they reverse-engineered a broken-down mech frame into a makeshift escape pod.
That experience broke Kieran’s trust in corporate labs and ivory-tower scientists. They left the labs behind, choosing instead the unpredictable freedom of mercenary life on the fringe colonies.

Known now as “Nano”, Kieran pilots their custom Everest frame, Polypheme, a brutal blend of frontier engineering and bleeding-edge tech. For them, battle is just another system to solve — another machine to take apart, bit by bit.

They live by one rule: never trust a system you didn’t build yourself.
history: Kieran Vasquez was a nano-scale systems engineer turned mech pilot after a catastrophic accident at the research facility left them stranded in deep orbit with nothing but their personal tools and a derelict frame. They retrofitted a broken-down chassis using their nanotech expertise—creating a custom integration of advanced micro-scale reactors and weapon systems.

systems.flavorDescription: The GMS Type-3 Projected Shield traps and denies incoming projectiles by projecting an aggressive, superpositional anti-ballistic barrier.

The GMS Companion/Concierge-Class Assistant Unit conforms to all galaxy-wide standards. These virtual assistants pass even the most rigid Turing-Null assessment criteria and are cleared to operate even in the absence of a pilot.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-II (T-2) line displays GMS’s proprietary “charged” melee weapons and energy weapons.

The Type-II (T-2) line displays GMS’s proprietary “charged” melee weapons and energy weapons.

weapons.flavorDescription: These weapons are pre-modern devices like muskets and bows, all of which are still used in some societies.
Heavy signature weapons are missile tubes, heavy lasers, light machine gun, or exotic rifles.

gear.flavorDescription: This kit contains many essentials for surviving in hostile environments: a rebreather, water filters, hardsuit patches, backup thermals, a bivouac kit, and so on.

Small, non-combat drones are a common sight in the field. They’re fairly noisy but can fly about half a mile with good maneuverability before losing signal, relaying audio and visual information as they go.

A collar-like device that fits snugly around its wearer’s neck, projecting a holographic image over their face and head. Prosocollars can change their wearer’s voice and scramble or change their appearance. The projection won’t stand up to close inspection, but it can easily fool electronic systems and distant observers.
